intro: Elatostema halconense, commonly known as the Halconense Elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
